name: Church Choir Singer - Cleric 16 / Bard 20 / Fighter 4
author: Kane

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

I was helping someone at the Build Request section and ended up coming with a cool original build that I hadn't thought possible. If you want the devcrit version of this build, go to the original topic: http://nwnecbguild.44.forumer.com/need- ... 16647.html

This toon utilizes many synergies between Cleric and Bard buffs, which grant extreme spell maneuverability. You should try to get some of the boosts with items in order to make room for more copies of important spells such as Divine Power, Divine Favor, Darkfire, etc. Obviously, in order to explore these synergies, I had to forego two things: HP and INT, which left me unable to get IKD, Expertise or even more skills. You can tweak Expertise into the build by losing 1 damage. You drop you starting STR to 13 and up your INT to 13, then replace KD with Expertise to make use of the Taunt / Expertise combo. Then in epics, swap one of the Great Strengths for Epic Prowess, ending up on the same AB. I just felt that his AC was already very high, so I didn't feel the need to up it any further, although early on it's a bit of a problem with the low HP and DEX. Solution: Use summons!

Aura of Vitality helps a bit with HP, as does Extended Endurance (cuz lvl 2 slots are for Extended DIvine Favor), which should be memorized in at least two instances. This toon is very buff-reliant, so dispel is his main enemy. How do you counter that? You don't, basically, you just get your most important stuff from items and have multiple copies of your buffs spread through your spellbook. Not much else you can do.

This is a very strong offensive and defensive build. With Bard Song, Divine Shield and all the Cleric buffs, you should have a VERY HIGH AC. With Taunt, Curse Song and Cleric buffs, you should have a very good AB / Damage output. But, as said before, without your buffs, you ain't much of a bother. This is a very big issue PvP, but in PvM, you just use a couple of spells and wait for your enemies to dispel you before you actually buff up. NWN AI is still pretty silly, thankfully.

Craft Wand can be sneaked into the build in place of KD. Consider that a 50-50 tweak. Do it of you're running out of spells before rests.

It takes a while for the Bard side of the build to mature, but who has ever had trouble leveling a Cleric up? The build just never stops growing even though it lags a bit in the late 20s, early 30s until your Perform skill and Bard Song grow stronger.

Still, the result was still quite pleasing to see. Ladies and gents: The Church Choir Singer!

Cleric(16), Bard(20), Fighter(4), Human

Alignment: Any non-lawful

Playability: 1-40 PvM

STR: 14 (26)
DEX: 8
CON: 8
WIS: 16 (18)
INT: 12
CHA: 16

Human: (Quick to Master)

Hitpoints: 248
Skillpoints: 218
Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 21/27/18
Saving Throw bonuses:
BAB: 25
AB (max, naked): 36 (melee), 24 (ranged)
AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 19/30
Spell Casting: Cleric(8),Bard(6)
Alignment Changes: 0

Concentration 43(42), Lore 14(35), Perform 42(45), Taunt 42(45), Tumble 40(39), UMD 37(40)

40: Concentration(1), Lore(3),

Fully-buffed AB is 62, +5 from Curse Song and +6 from Taunt can add up to an INCREDIBLE effective AB of 73! If you can Taunt them, you can hit them!

Fully-buffed AC is 72:

10 (Base)
+1 (DEX from AoV)
+8 (Full Plate)
+3 (Tower Shield)
+5 (Barkskin)
+5 (MV - Armor)
+5 (MV - Shield)
+5 (Deflection - item, otherwise +4 with SoF)
+8 (Tumble)
+4 (Haste)
+9 (DS w/ Capped CHA)
+5 (Bard Song)
+2 (Boots of Hardiness or Mage Armor +1 Dodge from item - caps Dodge AC)
+2 (Debuff from Bard Song)

If you want to be really optimistic, you can add +2 from Battletide debuff and +1 from Prayer debuff and this build can technically (but very unlikely) reach 75 AC pretty much on its own. That's actually quite good for a STR build with no PM levels, aye?

Similar Builds:

The Happy Helper by Sneaky Sneaker
Harbinger of Sorrow by Grimnir77
Ancilla by Mithdradates

The first and the third builds are party-oriented toons. They are built for one purpose, to aid others, and they're excellent at that. The second variant is a wisdom-based caster with spell focus. This toon is different. He is a very proficient even though easily dispellable meleer. He has DM/DS, lvl 20 Bard Song with Lasting Inspiration and Curse Song, a Scimitar with EWS and Improved Critical, and finally, access to all Cleric and Bard buffs. Fully-buffed, he is a very capable meleer with impressive combat stats. Unbuffed, he's an average joe that can still help out as a party support.

Hope you enjoy!

Take it EZ!

Yet another incomplete build.  Well, at least you are consistent in creating builds that require someone's duplication of effort to run with it.

Besides the missing skill allotment, this build contains 28 levels of -20% XP penalty.  Max doesn't seem to feel it is important to mention, but you might.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: And I thought you had been swallowed up by the Brazilian landscape.  All those hungry panthers and pythons roaming the streets.  What a surprise!  Now I can take a vacation.  I hope you can spend more time with us cuz we sure could use it.  Maximillian Kane is not just a figment of our imagination today
